text: At the time, this year is about 2008 or 7? 9? 8 or 9. This time was very hard because our resident of surgery part was very rare and our job was very hard. And the professors didn't help us with many jobs. They always ordered many things to us. And I finished my residency in 2009. After that, the atmosphere changed to a better situation. For example, the salary of the resident increased more, about 70 percent. And helpers like surgical assistants or physician assistants were recruited. And working hours decreased. When I was a resident, working hours was about 24 hours. It was about almost one day. 24 hours? No, not at all. Every day. But the change of working hours made it 12 hours per resident.
